scenarioDescription:
The HD 7924 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 7924 is a star with 0.65 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.78 times its radius. It is located 55.42 light years away from the solar system.

HD 7924 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 7924 system


HD 7924 b

HD 7924 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2009-05, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 7924 b is 6.360 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 7924 b is 2.400 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 7924 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


HD 7924 c

HD 7924 c was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2015-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.11 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 7924 c is 7.864 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 7924 c is 2.720 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 7924 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


HD 7924 d

HD 7924 d was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2015-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.16 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 7924 d is 6.443 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 7924 d is 2.420 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 7924 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 7924, which contains 3 exoplanets and was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory.
name: HD 7924 - System With 3 Exolanets
